channel.title: CVE Feed for The curl Project -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for The curl Project -- all products

item.title: CVE-2018-16839|2024-08-05T10:32:54.082Z -- the%20curl%20project -- curl%3A
item.description: Curl versions 7.33.0 through 7.61.1 are vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the SASL authentication code that may lead to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2018-16840|2024-08-05T10:32:53.993Z -- the%20curl%20project -- curl
item.description: A heap use-after-free flaw was found in curl versions from 7.59.0 through 7.61.1 in the code related to closing an easy handle. When closing and cleaning up an 'easy' handle in the `Curl_close()` function, the library code first frees a struct (without nulling the pointer) and might then subsequently erroneously write to a struct field within that already freed struct.

item.title: CVE-2018-16842|2024-08-05T10:32:54.082Z -- the%20curl%20project -- curl%3A
item.description: Curl versions 7.14.1 through 7.61.1 are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in the tool_msgs.c:voutf() function that may result in information exposure and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2018-16890|2024-08-05T10:39:57.668Z -- the%20curl%20project -- curl
item.description: libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.
